intro: Cynoglossum hystrix, commonly known as the spurred gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges and meadows, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
